transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things.
They need to accept many things better.
Many people think the church is losing followers.
People do not like the church's old views.
The church is not kind to gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.
People do not agree with these views.
If the church changes, it will keep more followers.
People want the church to change.
They want things to be more modern.
The church does not allow female priests or married priests.
This does not help the church.
The church thinks priests are married to God.
But other people have families.
It is not fair that priests cannot have families too.

I am not against gay marriage. I do not think it is a choice. People are born this way. Gay people should not be blamed. It is wrong to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. The federal government should not decide. It is not their business. Love is not wrong. People are born gay. They should not be punished.

I believe that same-sex marriage should be legal. There are no good reasons not to. Many people think that same-sex couples harm traditional families. But this is not true. Same-sex relationships are different. Each has its own rules and roles. This is like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are not the same, but they are the same thing.

Same-sex couples should have the same rights as heterosexual couples. This includes property taxes and healthcare. If someone is in a same-sex relationship, their partner cannot visit them in the hospital. This is not fair. If a couple is together, they should have the same rights.

Many studies show that same-sex couples can be successful and happy. They have the same types of relationships as heterosexual couples.

People worry about adoption and community issues. But these are the same as in any family. Children of same-sex couples are just like any other children. They should be treated equally.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. This should be the opposite of the current amendment. But the current president has strong religious views on this topic. He is against it because of his religious beliefs.

Many people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. People should listen to research, not just their friends and family.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer.

Just because a drug is illegal, it does not mean it has good use.

I do not think it should be available to everyone. But, it can be used for medicine.

Many drugs are illegal but good. Like oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets. We use them because they help.

I do not think it is like alcohol. If you abuse alcohol, it is bad. But, marijuana is different.

It is hard to decide. I think we should make it legal slowly.

People think marijuana is bad. But, it is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine.

We should change how people think about marijuana. Then, people can use it responsibly for medicine.

I think the church has changed to fit the 21st century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore cute little dresses, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school. We saw our friends there on weekends. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers. It is only 30 minutes long. People wear more casual clothes, like beach clothes even in the summer. Families come in late. People wear jeans and khakis now. The church has become more casual. As for other things, I do not know much about the church's politics. That is all.

I first liked the idea of the Iraq war. But people were upset after the attack on September 11. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons to cause harm. This was not true. This made me very angry. The administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who had a big speech at the United Nations, said he was not sure about the evidence. I think this is wrong. I think it is a bad thing to lie to the people. I think the Bush administration does not care about the constitution. They want to use the war to get more oil. The war has been going on for a long time. If we leave now, Iraq might have a big problem. Many people might die. There is a plan to have other countries help. But this might cause more problems. Iraq's government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. There are many groups fighting for power. None of this is good.

I talk about the Iraq War.
First, I say it's not a real war. Congress did not declare it.
I think we went to Iraq because we thought Iraq did 9/11.
I don't follow the war closely. I don't know the details.
Now, we say we stay to help build democracy there.
But this is hard. Democracy takes time.
If we leave, Iraq will be worse. We must help them.
But, staying there makes us look bad, like Vietnam.
I don't think the war should still go on.
It's hard because many families have people in Iraq.
I feel bad for George W. Bush.
The war is taking many years. It's hard to end it.
There's also Al-Qaeda. They hate us more because we try to change Iraq.
I think the war will go on for a long time.

I do not agree with making it legal or allowing states to make it legal. The Constitution says churches and state should be separate. The Constitution is clear about this. So, trying to change it would be wrong. People who want to make it illegal are choosing one religion's beliefs over others. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. The government should not decide what churches can make legal or illegal. The separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance in the United States. Making an amendment about it would be wrong and contradictory to the Constitution. It would also be the only amendment used to restrict people, not the government. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for the amendment is just because he is a Catholic and has a preference for his religion over others. I think churches should decide this, not the government. There is no good reason for an amendment to ban it. It might even have a positive impact on society. I have said all I need to say.

Government did not tell people true story about Iraq war.
Before war, government tried to make people think Iraq was linked to 9/11 attacks.
People got angry about 9/11, so government started war in 2003.
I did not like war, especially preemptive strikes.
War in Iraq like Vietnam, many soldiers died.
Government not ready for war after.
They wanted to make Iraq democratic, like Vietnam.
But it is hard to make democracy in other countries.
Government told people it would be easy.
War long and many Americans died.
It is hard to make democracy in another country.
Government tried to trick people.
War should not have started.
If start war, plan for all outcomes.
Government not ready for what happened.
War still going, many Americans dying.
Government should have told people truth.
War about oil, not weapons.
Let's hope war ends soon.
Peace not likely soon.

I think gay marriage is right. I always have. It is a personal choice. It is not controlled by people. It is unfair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. I think it is cruel. I always support gay marriage. I think government should not interfere. It is a personal choice, not a political one. People in my neighborhood are gay. They live like normal families. President Bush tries to change marriage. I think it is wrong. Many people say it is a natural thing. It is not caused by upbringing. I think marriage should be private, not public. I think it is unfair that gay people cannot marry openly.

When you put things online, everyone can see them. It is not private.
As a Resident Assistant, I have seen this happen.
If you say something about harm, someone will believe it.
The internet lets everyone see.
If someone is friends with you on MySpace, they see your posts.
The school gets the message.
If a student says something bad, the school must act.
They must take it seriously.
They cannot ignore it.
Sometimes, people say things to fool around.
It can also be very serious.
One time, someone heard something bad.
They told the school.
The school looked at Facebook.
They found something wrong.
The person did not mean it.
But after the bad thing happened, it looked very serious.
You cannot control what people think.
You cannot stop them from taking things seriously.
School officials should not look at students' Facebook and MySpace pages.
But if someone tells the school something bad, they must take it seriously.
They cannot ignore it.
They must act.
But they should not look at phone conversations and texts.

The war has lasted too long.
The original purpose was good.
It was to give democracy to a country without fair politics.
But we lost sight of that purpose.
Now, we fight just to prove we are a powerful country.
Maybe the start was about Bush's father's past with Saddam Hussein.
So, I think the original reason was fair if it was just democracy.
But, the war went on too long.
We should stop now.
Their government should handle it.
We spend too much money on war.
We have our own problems on our own land.
We should improve schools, health, and roads.
War is not a long-term solution.
We should stop the war.

I want to ask a question.
Is it true that something was stopped because someone looked at a profile online?
If so, this might not be a privacy problem. When you put information on the internet, many people can see it. For example, on Myspace, you need to be a member to see profiles. But if you accept this, you give permission for people to see your profile.
If you post something online, you must know that many people will see it. So, I think it was good that someone stopped something bad from happening.
But, it is hard to have one person checking all students' profiles every day.
This might feel like discrimination if only bad students are checked. But maybe the person was really looking for something.
I don't have a Myspace, but I use Facebook. I worry about people knowing too much about me online.
I can't meet someone I don't know online. But I know people who use my nickname to talk to me. They know my interests and where I am.
I try to limit what I put online. But I want to communicate with friends. I only accept people I know.
I don't know how much control school officials have over students having Myspace.
My roommate told me that students in her high school weren't allowed to have Myspace. This seemed strange.
I don't know if this is a privacy issue, but I don't think schools should tell students what they can do online.

Hmm
I need to talk about Iraq War one more time.
I feel bad. I hate to say I was against it from the start.
It's not important now.
Many people think it was bad idea.
Most people in the world think it was bad idea.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of people think it was bad idea.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was bad idea.
Seventy percent of American troops there think it was bad idea.
Iraq was already bad before we went there.
It's bad now. Pulling out will be bad.
No easy way to deal with Middle East.
There is big difference between United States and Middle East.
United States think they can bring democracy there.
That's not right. Iraqis want to run their own lives.
Iraq was bad before Saddam. But, we should think about pros and cons before going there.
It's like quicksand.
I don't know what to say.
I don't see reason to stay.
Administration has good reasons to stay. I don't agree.
I don't hear good reasons to stay longer.
Gradual pull-out over a year or so is okay.
I don't see reason to stay now.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think we should leave now.
They are the people we want to save.
They tell us to leave.
If we ask and they say yes, we can say we tried.
If things go wrong, it's not our fault.
We can help later. We can be good guys.
It's better than now.
No.

Yes, I believe gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects many fields of work.
Women face the "glass ceiling," even though they are qualified.
Society thinks men should be in charge.
Men face issues too, like staying home as a parent.
Society often does not accept these roles.
In the fashion industry, men are not always taken seriously.
Society has these ideas and it takes time to change.
Women are becoming more accepted in the business world.
Men staying home is becoming more accepted.
Society is changing slowly.
Discrimination happens based on jobs and where people come from.
People may judge based on grammar or gender.
It's important to change slowly.

The law did not make it legal. It changed it to a minor offense instead. Now, if caught, people get a ticket. This is like a traffic ticket, not going to jail.

Decriminalizing may help with money. Arresting, jailing, and court cases cost a lot. Saving this money can help communities. For example, Denver has more money for education and helping elderly and homeless people.

Many people think marijuana is not right for society. It might feel awkward to smoke in public. Also, different people react differently to drugs. Some are more careful. Others are not.

Some things in the Catholic Church are old. They do the same things for a long time.
That’s good because it’s traditional.
But it’s also important to change.
Many Catholics think they must go to church every week. They follow rules closely.
Sometimes, I feel the Church does not accept people who don’t follow rules well.
The Church also does not accept people of other religions.
For example, my dad was an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. They wouldn’t marry in the Catholic Church.
That’s not accepting other religions.
Catholics should love others. But the Church does not always accept them.
Some rules are old and not fair. But the Church still follows them.
Letting priests marry might be a good idea. But it wouldn’t stop bad things.
Pedophiles might do bad things regardless of being married.
So, letting priests marry wouldn’t stop that.

I do not know.
I have not decided.
This topic is very hard.
Church and state separation is close.
Marriage definition is also hard.
I think marriage should be like civil unions.
People do not get special treatment for marriage.
They do not get tax breaks.
Gay marriage should just be called a civil union.
I think all states should decide.
If they agree, they should make it federal law.
A constitutional amendment is not needed.
It is not as important.

I grew up in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a grey area for me. I have many gay friends. I don’t understand that lifestyle, but I think it should be legal. It should not be a national issue. Each state should decide. Some states are democratic and some are republican. Democratic states support gay marriage. Living in a democratic state, you should follow their decision. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. I don’t think the president should decide for the whole country. Each state should decide. Bush should not decide for the whole country. He doesn’t live in every state. He shouldn’t decide for each state. Some things should be left to each state. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will go back and forth. States should decide. They will live with the decision. Not the president.

Myspace is a public website. People can see what you post. If you post there, you must know that many people can see. This includes school officials. They should look at it. It is their responsibility to keep students safe. If they find something that might cause harm, they should act. This is not an invasion of privacy. They should not look just to catch students. They should only look to make the school safer. If they find something that helps, they should act. Parents trust schools to be safe. School officials should make this happen.

The war
At first, I was for it. I was affected by nine eleven. I thought it was right to go and cause trouble there, like they did here.
But now, I am against it. I think it did not help.
I think the people there fight with each other. They do not fight with us.
They need to solve their own problems.
I do not care about what happens over there anymore.
I think they are not like us. They fight with each other.
We did not have a good plan before we went there.
We did not know what to expect.
We were angry and wanted revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war.
We had to act, but we did not have a good plan.
We did not think about what would happen.
We did not know what to do to help.
We did not have a good plan.
We were just angry and wanted revenge.
I do not think we can change them.
They will always be like that.
We should not stay there forever.
We are hurting ourselves by staying there.
No.

The Catholic Church needs to change some things.
They need to accept many things better.
Many people think the church is losing followers.
People do not like the church's old views.
The church is not kind to gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.
People do not agree with these views.
If the church changes, it will keep more followers.
People want the church to change.
They want things to be more modern.
The church does not allow female priests or married priests.
This does not help the church.
The church thinks priests are married to God.
But other people have families.
It is not fair that priests cannot have families too.

I am not against gay marriage. I do not think it is a choice. People are born this way. Gay people should not be blamed. It is wrong to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. The federal government should not decide. It is not their business. Love is not wrong. People are born gay. They should not be punished.

I believe that same-sex marriage should be legal. There are no good reasons not to. Many people think that same-sex couples harm traditional families. But this is not true. Same-sex relationships are different. Each has its own rules and roles. This is like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are not the same, but they are the same thing.

Same-sex couples should have the same rights as heterosexual couples. This includes property taxes and healthcare. If someone is in a same-sex relationship, their partner cannot visit them in the hospital. This is not fair. If a couple is together, they should have the same rights.

Many studies show that same-sex couples can be successful and happy. They have the same types of relationships as heterosexual couples.

People worry about adoption and community issues. But these are the same as in any family. Children of same-sex couples are just like any other children. They should be treated equally.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. This should be the opposite of the current amendment. But the current president has strong religious views on this topic. He is against it because of his religious beliefs.

Many people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. People should listen to research, not just their friends and family.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer.

Just because a drug is illegal, it does not mean it has good use.

I do not think it should be available to everyone. But, it can be used for medicine.

Many drugs are illegal but good. Like oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets. We use them because they help.

I do not think it is like alcohol. If you abuse alcohol, it is bad. But, marijuana is different.

It is hard to decide. I think we should make it legal slowly.

People think marijuana is bad. But, it is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine.

We should change how people think about marijuana. Then, people can use it responsibly for medicine.

I think the church has changed to fit the 21st century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore cute little dresses, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school. We saw our friends there on weekends. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers. It is only 30 minutes long. People wear more casual clothes, like beach clothes even in the summer. Families come in late. People wear jeans and khakis now. The church has become more casual. As for other things, I do not know much about the church's politics. That is all.

I first liked the idea of the Iraq war. But people were upset after the attack on September 11. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons to cause harm. This was not true. This made me very angry. The administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who had a big speech at the United Nations, said he was not sure about the evidence. I think this is wrong. I think it is a bad thing to lie to the people. I think the Bush administration does not care about the constitution. They want to use the war to get more oil. The war has been going on for a long time. If we leave now, Iraq might have a big problem. Many people might die. There is a plan to have other countries help. But this might cause more problems. Iraq's government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. There are many groups fighting for power. None of this is good.

I talk about the Iraq War.
First, I say it's not a real war. Congress did not declare it.
I think we went to Iraq because we thought Iraq did 9/11.
I don't follow the war closely. I don't know the details.
Now, we say we stay to help build democracy there.
But this is hard. Democracy takes time.
If we leave, Iraq will be worse. We must help them.
But, staying there makes us look bad, like Vietnam.
I don't think the war should still go on.
It's hard because many families have people in Iraq.
I feel bad for George W. Bush.
The war is taking many years. It's hard to end it.
There's also Al-Qaeda. They hate us more because we try to change Iraq.
I think the war will go on for a long time.

I do not agree with making it legal or allowing states to make it legal. The Constitution says churches and state should be separate. The Constitution is clear about this. So, trying to change it would be wrong. People who want to make it illegal are choosing one religion's beliefs over others. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. The government should not decide what churches can make legal or illegal. The separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance in the United States. Making an amendment about it would be wrong and contradictory to the Constitution. It would also be the only amendment used to restrict people, not the government. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for the amendment is just because he is a Catholic and has a preference for his religion over others. I think churches should decide this, not the government. There is no good reason for an amendment to ban it. It might even have a positive impact on society. I have said all I need to say.

Government did not tell people true story about Iraq war.
Before war, government tried to make people think Iraq was linked to 9/11 attacks.
People got angry about 9/11, so government started war in 2003.
I did not like war, especially preemptive strikes.
War in Iraq like Vietnam, many soldiers died.
Government not ready for war after.
They wanted to make Iraq democratic, like Vietnam.
But it is hard to make democracy in other countries.
Government told people it would be easy.
War long and many Americans died.
It is hard to make democracy in another country.
Government tried to trick people.
War should not have started.
If start war, plan for all outcomes.
Government not ready for what happened.
War still going, many Americans dying.
Government should have told people truth.
War about oil, not weapons.
Let's hope war ends soon.
Peace not likely soon.

I think gay marriage is right. I always have. It is a personal choice. It is not controlled by people. It is unfair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. I think it is cruel. I always support gay marriage. I think government should not interfere. It is a personal choice, not a political one. People in my neighborhood are gay. They live like normal families. President Bush tries to change marriage. I think it is wrong. Many people say it is a natural thing. It is not caused by upbringing. I think marriage should be private, not public. I think it is unfair that gay people cannot marry openly.

When you put things online, everyone can see them. It is not private.
As a Resident Assistant, I have seen this happen.
If you say something about harm, someone will believe it.
The internet lets everyone see.
If someone is friends with you on MySpace, they see your posts.
The school gets the message.
If a student says something bad, the school must act.
They must take it seriously.
They cannot ignore it.
Sometimes, people say things to fool around.
It can also be very serious.
One time, someone heard something bad.
They told the school.
The school looked at Facebook.
They found something wrong.
The person did not mean it.
But after the bad thing happened, it looked very serious.
You cannot control what people think.
You cannot stop them from taking things seriously.
School officials should not look at students' Facebook and MySpace pages.
But if someone tells the school something bad, they must take it seriously.
They cannot ignore it.
They must act.
But they should not look at phone conversations and texts.

The war has lasted too long.
The original purpose was good.
It was to give democracy to a country without fair politics.
But we lost sight of that purpose.
Now, we fight just to prove we are a powerful country.
Maybe the start was about Bush's father's past with Saddam Hussein.
So, I think the original reason was fair if it was just democracy.
But, the war went on too long.
We should stop now.
Their government should handle it.
We spend too much money on war.
We have our own problems on our own land.
We should improve schools, health, and roads.
War is not a long-term solution.
We should stop the war.

I want to ask a question.
Is it true that something was stopped because someone looked at a profile online?
If so, this might not be a privacy problem. When you put information on the internet, many people can see it. For example, on Myspace, you need to be a member to see profiles. But if you accept this, you give permission for people to see your profile.
If you post something online, you must know that many people will see it. So, I think it was good that someone stopped something bad from happening.
But, it is hard to have one person checking all students' profiles every day.
This might feel like discrimination if only bad students are checked. But maybe the person was really looking for something.
I don't have a Myspace, but I use Facebook. I worry about people knowing too much about me online.
I can't meet someone I don't know online. But I know people who use my nickname to talk to me. They know my interests and where I am.
I try to limit what I put online. But I want to communicate with friends. I only accept people I know.
I don't know how much control school officials have over students having Myspace.
My roommate told me that students in her high school weren't allowed to have Myspace. This seemed strange.
I don't know if this is a privacy issue, but I don't think schools should tell students what they can do online.

Hmm
I need to talk about Iraq War one more time.
I feel bad. I hate to say I was against it from the start.
It's not important now.
Many people think it was bad idea.
Most people in the world think it was bad idea.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of people think it was bad idea.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was bad idea.
Seventy percent of American troops there think it was bad idea.
Iraq was already bad before we went there.
It's bad now. Pulling out will be bad.
No easy way to deal with Middle East.
There is big difference between United States and Middle East.
United States think they can bring democracy there.
That's not right. Iraqis want to run their own lives.
Iraq was bad before Saddam. But, we should think about pros and cons before going there.
It's like quicksand.
I don't know what to say.
I don't see reason to stay.
Administration has good reasons to stay. I don't agree.
I don't hear good reasons to stay longer.
Gradual pull-out over a year or so is okay.
I don't see reason to stay now.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think we should leave now.
They are the people we want to save.
They tell us to leave.
If we ask and they say yes, we can say we tried.
If things go wrong, it's not our fault.
We can help later. We can be good guys.
It's better than now.
No.

Yes, I believe gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects many fields of work.
Women face the "glass ceiling," even though they are qualified.
Society thinks men should be in charge.
Men face issues too, like staying home as a parent.
Society often does not accept these roles.
In the fashion industry, men are not always taken seriously.
Society has these ideas and it takes time to change.
Women are becoming more accepted in the business world.
Men staying home is becoming more accepted.
Society is changing slowly.
Discrimination happens based on jobs and where people come from.
People may judge based on grammar or gender.
It's important to change slowly.

The law did not make it legal. It changed it to a minor offense instead. Now, if caught, people get a ticket. This is like a traffic ticket, not going to jail.

Decriminalizing may help with money. Arresting, jailing, and court cases cost a lot. Saving this money can help communities. For example, Denver has more money for education and helping elderly and homeless people.

Many people think marijuana is not right for society. It might feel awkward to smoke in public. Also, different people react differently to drugs. Some are more careful. Others are not.

Some things in the Catholic Church are old. They do the same things for a long time.
That’s good because it’s traditional.
But it’s also important to change.
Many Catholics think they must go to church every week. They follow rules closely.
Sometimes, I feel the Church does not accept people who don’t follow rules well.
The Church also does not accept people of other religions.
For example, my dad was an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. They wouldn’t marry in the Catholic Church.
That’s not accepting other religions.
Catholics should love others. But the Church does not always accept them.
Some rules are old and not fair. But the Church still follows them.
Letting priests marry might be a good idea. But it wouldn’t stop bad things.
Pedophiles might do bad things regardless of being married.
So, letting priests marry wouldn’t stop that.

I do not know.
I have not decided.
This topic is very hard.
Church and state separation is close.
Marriage definition is also hard.
I think marriage should be like civil unions.
People do not get special treatment for marriage.
They do not get tax breaks.
Gay marriage should just be called a civil union.
I think all states should decide.
If they agree, they should make it federal law.
A constitutional amendment is not needed.
It is not as important.

I grew up in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a grey area for me. I have many gay friends. I don’t understand that lifestyle, but I think it should be legal. It should not be a national issue. Each state should decide. Some states are democratic and some are republican. Democratic states support gay marriage. Living in a democratic state, you should follow their decision. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. I don’t think the president should decide for the whole country. Each state should decide. Bush should not decide for the whole country. He doesn’t live in every state. He shouldn’t decide for each state. Some things should be left to each state. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will go back and forth. States should decide. They will live with the decision. Not the president.

Myspace is a public website. People can see what you post. If you post there, you must know that many people can see. This includes school officials. They should look at it. It is their responsibility to keep students safe. If they find something that might cause harm, they should act. This is not an invasion of privacy. They should not look just to catch students. They should only look to make the school safer. If they find something that helps, they should act. Parents trust schools to be safe. School officials should make this happen.

The war
At first, I was for it. I was affected by nine eleven. I thought it was right to go and cause trouble there, like they did here.
But now, I am against it. I think it did not help.
I think the people there fight with each other. They do not fight with us.
They need to solve their own problems.
I do not care about what happens over there anymore.
I think they are not like us. They fight with each other.
We did not have a good plan before we went there.
We did not know what to expect.
We were angry and wanted revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war.
We had to act, but we did not have a good plan.
We did not think about what would happen.
We did not know what to do to help.
We did not have a good plan.
We were just angry and wanted revenge.
I do not think we can change them.
They will always be like that.
We should not stay there forever.
We are hurting ourselves by staying there.
No.

The Catholic Church needs to change some things.
They need to accept many things better.
Many people think the church is losing followers.
People do not like the church's old views.
The church is not kind to gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.
People do not agree with these views.
If the church changes, it will keep more followers.
People want the church to change.
They want things to be more modern.
The church does not allow female priests or married priests.
This does not help the church.
The church thinks priests are married to God.
But other people have families.
It is not fair that priests cannot have families too.

I am not against gay marriage. I do not think it is a choice. People are born this way. Gay people should not be blamed. It is wrong to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. The federal government should not decide. It is not their business. Love is not wrong. People are born gay. They should not be punished.

I believe that same-sex marriage should be legal. There are no good reasons not to. Many people think that same-sex couples harm traditional families. But this is not true. Same-sex relationships are different. Each has its own rules and roles. This is like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are not the same, but they are the same thing.

Same-sex couples should have the same rights as heterosexual couples. This includes property taxes and healthcare. If someone is in a same-sex relationship, their partner cannot visit them in the hospital. This is not fair. If a couple is together, they should have the same rights.

Many studies show that same-sex couples can be successful and happy. They have the same types of relationships as heterosexual couples.

People worry about adoption and community issues. But these are the same as in any family. Children of same-sex couples are just like any other children. They should be treated equally.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. This should be the opposite of the current amendment. But the current president has strong religious views on this topic. He is against it because of his religious beliefs.

Many people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. People should listen to research, not just their friends and family.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer.

Just because a drug is illegal, it does not mean it has good use.

I do not think it should be available to everyone. But, it can be used for medicine.

Many drugs are illegal but good. Like oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets. We use them because they help.

I do not think it is like alcohol. If you abuse alcohol, it is bad. But, marijuana is different.

It is hard to decide. I think we should make it legal slowly.

People think marijuana is bad. But, it is not like drugs like heroin or cocaine.

We should change how people think about marijuana. Then, people can use it responsibly for medicine.

I think the church has changed to fit the 21st century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore cute little dresses, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school. We saw our friends there on weekends. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers. It is only 30 minutes long. People wear more casual clothes, like beach clothes even in the summer. Families come in late. People wear jeans and khakis now. The church has become more casual. As for other things, I do not know much about the church's politics. That is all.

I first liked the idea of the Iraq war. But people were upset after the attack on September 11. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons to cause harm. This was not true. This made me very angry. The administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who had a big speech at the United Nations, said he was not sure about the evidence. I think this is wrong. I think it is a bad thing to lie to the people. I think the Bush administration does not care about the constitution. They want to use the war to get more oil. The war has been going on for a long time. If we leave now, Iraq might have a big problem. Many people might die. There is a plan to have other countries help. But this might cause more problems. Iraq's government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. There are many groups fighting for power. None of this is good.

I talk about the Iraq War.
First, I say it's not a real war. Congress did not declare it.
I think we went to Iraq because we thought Iraq did 9/11.
I don't follow the war closely. I don't know the details.
Now, we say we stay to help build democracy there.
But this is hard. Democracy takes time.
If we leave, Iraq will be worse. We must help them.
But, staying there makes us look bad, like Vietnam.
I don't think the war should still go on.
It's hard because many families have people in Iraq.
I feel bad for George W. Bush.
The war is taking many years. It's hard to end it.
There's also Al-Qaeda. They hate us more because we try to change Iraq.
I think the war will go on for a long time.

I do not agree with making it legal or allowing states to make it legal. The Constitution says churches and state should be separate. The Constitution is clear about this. So, trying to change it would be wrong. People who want to make it illegal are choosing one religion's beliefs over others. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. The government should not decide what churches can make legal or illegal. The separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance in the United States. Making an amendment about it would be wrong and contradictory to the Constitution. It would also be the only amendment used to restrict people, not the government. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for the amendment is just because he is a Catholic and has a preference for his religion over others. I think churches should decide this, not the government. There is no good reason for an amendment to ban it. It might even have a positive impact on society. I have said all I need to say.

Government did not tell people true story about Iraq war.
Before war, government tried to make people think Iraq was linked to 9/11 attacks.
People got angry about 9/11, so government started war in 2003.
I did not like war, especially preemptive strikes.
War in Iraq like Vietnam, many soldiers died.

War long and many Americans died.

Government tried to trick people.
War should not have started.
If start war, plan for all outcomes.

War still going, many Americans dying.

War about oil, not weapons.
Let's hope war ends soon.

I think gay marriage is right. I always have. It is a personal choice. It is not controlled by people. It is unfair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. I think it is cruel. I always support gay marriage. I think government should not interfere. It is a personal choice, not a political one. People in my neighborhood are gay. They live like normal families. President Bush tries to change marriage. I think it is wrong. Many people say it is a natural thing. It is not caused by upbringing. I think marriage should be private, not public. I think it is unfair that gay people cannot marry openly.

The war has lasted too long.
The original purpose was good.
It was to give democracy to a country without fair politics.
But we lost sight of that purpose.
Now, we fight just to prove we are a powerful country.
Maybe the start was about Bush's father's past with Saddam Hussein.

But, the war went on too long.
We should stop now.
Their government should handle it.
We spend too much money on war.
We have our own problems on our own land.
We should improve schools, health, and roads.
War is not a long-term solution.
We should stop the war.

If so, this might not be a privacy problem. When you put information on the internet, many people can see it. For example, on Myspace, you need to be a member to see profiles. But if you accept this, you give permission for people to see your profile.

But, it is hard to have one person checking all students' profiles every day.

I don't know if this is a privacy issue, but I don't think schools should tell students what they can do online.

If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will go back and forth. States should decide. They will live with the decision. Not the president.

It is their responsibility to keep students safe. If they find something that might cause harm, they should act. This is not an invasion of privacy. They should not look just to catch students. They should only look to make the school safer. If they find something that helps, they should act. Parents trust schools to be safe. School officials should make this happen.

I think the people there fight with each other. They do not fight with us.
They need to solve their own problems.
I do not care about what happens over there anymore.
I think they are not like us. They fight with each other.
We did not have a good plan before we went there.
We did not know what to expect.
We were angry and wanted revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war.
We had to act, but we did not have a good plan.
We did not think about what would happen.
We did not know what to do to help.
We did not have a good plan.
We were just angry and wanted revenge.
I do not think we can change them.
They will always be like that.
We should not stay there forever.
We are hurting ourselves by staying there.
No.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change in some ways.
Many people leave the Catholic Church because they do not agree with their rules about certain things.
The Church has strong rules about marriage and family.
Some people do not like these rules.
They think the Church's rules are old-fashioned.
People want the Church to be more modern.
The Church does not allow women to be priests and priests to be married.
These rules make some people feel unwelcome.
People want the Church to change these rules.

I am not against same-sex marriage. I think people are born gay or not gay. It is not a choice. I think it is wrong to say one type of couple can marry, but not another. I have not thought much about this topic. But I would say it is wrong to tell gay people they cannot marry. I think people are born who they are and should not be blamed for it. I think the federal government should not be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is private. I think the government should not interfere with people's lives. I think it is wrong to punish people for being gay. That is it.

I think gay marriage should be legalized. There is no good reason to not allow it.

Many people think homosexual couples damage the traditional family. But this is not true. Homosexual couples are not the same as heterosexual couples. They are different but the same in many ways.

If gay couples can have civil unions, they should be able to marry. It is unfair to be second class citizens.

Gay couples have the same kind of success in relationships as heterosexual couples. They have the same factors that contribute to happiness.

Homosexuals are not asking to get married in a church. They just want a marriage certificate from the government. This should not cause a problem.

Many religious people are against gay marriage because they think it is against their religion. But the government should not enforce religious beliefs on everyone.

Many people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says this is not true.

The government should make gay marriage legal in every state. President Bush has strong views against it, but this is not a good reason.

People should listen to institutions that do research, not just popular opinion or their friends.

I work in a hospital pharmacy over the summer. Some drugs are illegal but they can help people. Like oxycodone and vicodin. We use them in hospitals because they help. Marijuana is also illegal. But it can help too. We should let people use it for sickness. Not all at once. We should make it legal slowly. And we should stop thinking it is bad. Many people think it is bad because it is illegal. But we should think about the good things it can do. Like help sick people.

I think the church changed to fit the twenty-first century.
It is not as strict as before.
When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a matching purse.
I went to a private school. I saw many friends there on weekends.
Now, they have a teenager's mass. It is only thirty minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in summer.
Families come late, sometimes in beach clothes.
I think the church is more casual now, even at morning masses.
People wear jeans and khakis instead of formal clothes.
I don't know the politics inside the church.
That's the biggest change I noticed.
About the accusations against Catholic priests, I don't think changes like allowing female priests or married priests could have prevented it.
Some married men become pedophiles.
I think it is about genetics, not the church rules.
People are born that way. They can't change it with marriage.
I think the church couldn't prevent this.
If they knew and covered it up, they are wrong.
But I think, in many cases, they didn't know.
I don't have other thoughts about the Catholic church.

I was okay with the plan at first. But, after September 11th, people were shocked. The Bush administration thought Saddam Hussein was like Osama Bin Laden. They said he had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true.

I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. They did not admit their mistake. Even Colin Powell, who presented evidence at the UN, said he did not believe it then. I think this is wrong. It is like breaking the rules.

I think they did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war. The younger Bush had a strong feeling against Saddam Hussein because his father was president. I think he also wanted more oil.

I think the war has lasted too long. If we leave now, the country might have a civil war. Many people will die. But, the UN plan seems bad too. Other countries might try to help, but this could cause more problems.

The government is not strong. The parliament is not working well. The prime minister has no control. Radical groups fight each other for power. The political process is hard.

I talk about the Iraq War. I say it is not a real war. It is not declared by Congress. It is like a big fight. We do it to show we are strong. But I do not think it should be a war. I think we make it worse. We try to make Iraq like the U.S. But this is hard. We waste our resources. We can make more problems. We make others angry. We can make the whole situation worse. I do not think we should stay there. We should not change their culture. It is better to let them be themselves. This will help in the long run. I think this will go on for a long time.

I don't think it's right to make it legal or for a state to declare it as legal.
I believe it's up to the churches.
The constitution says church and state must be separate.
Trying to change this would go against what's already in the constitution.
I think people trying to make it illegal are choosing one church's beliefs over others.
Most Catholics and Christians are against it.
Government should not decide what churches can make illegal or legal.
Separation of church and state is important in the constitution.
Making an amendment about this would be wrong.
An amendment could restrict people more than the government.
I don't think the government should be involved.
The president's push for this amendment is because of his Catholic beliefs.
It's not fair to choose one religion over others.
I think churches should decide this, not the government.
There is no good reason for an amendment except personal views.
It might even help society.

The Iraq War
I think the government was not fully honest about the reasons for war before it started.
I think they wanted to connect Iraq to the 9/11 attacks, but this was not true.
The government made people think this was true to get people to support the war.
The war started in 2003.
I am against war, especially when it is not needed.
The war in Iraq is similar to the Vietnam War.
Many American soldiers died.
The government was not ready for what would happen after removing the Iraqi government.
They tried to put a new government in, but this is hard and takes a long time.
The government did not tell people this would be hard.
They made people think it would be easy.
I think this is wrong.
The war is difficult to finish because we are there for a long time.
We should think about the American people who died.
We should also think about the cost of the war.
We should stop the war if it is not helping.
I hope the war ends soon, but I do not think it will.

I believe in gay marriage. I always have. It is a personal choice, not something to control with laws. It is not fair to take away rights from people. This is not their fault. I think it is wrong to stop people from doing what they want because of who they are. I always support gay marriage. I think the government should not decide who can marry. It is a personal decision, not a political one. Many gay couples live in my neighborhood. They are just like other families. They take care of their dogs and live their lives. It is not fair to say that Bush can decide what marriage means. I think this is ridiculous. I have read that people can be born this way. It is not something they choose. I think marriage is a private thing, not something for everyone to know about.

When you put something on the internet, many people see it. This is a public place. You cannot hide what you put there. If you talk about dangerous things like blowing things up or shootings, people may believe it. You cannot control what others think. If you want to protect your privacy, do not put private things on the internet. If you do not want something to be seen, do not put it on the internet. You cannot tell people what to think or not think. If you are worried about something dangerous, you can tell school officials. If they need to check, they can look at what is on the internet. They cannot listen to private conversations, but they can check what you put on the internet. They must take any real danger seriously. I do not think teachers should friend students on social media. It is not their place to know about private things. They should not look at students' social media if it is not necessary.

Long war not good. Start was good, to give democracy to country with bad government. But now, no clear reason. Just want to show power. Bush's father had old fight with Saddam Hussein. But, war goes on too long. We lost cause. Long time, too many people die. We should stop. Money for war, not good. Money should go to our own problems, like poverty and roads. War is not forever. We should spend money on our own people, not other country's war.

I have a question. Was the student’s profile stopped because someone found it online?

Yes, someone saw it and stopped it.

Is this a privacy problem?

No, it is not.

On sites like Myspace, what you post is seen by many people.

You have to agree with the person who sees your profile.

When you put information on the internet, many people see it.

If a profile was stopped, it might save a life.

That is difficult.

Many people cannot look at all student profiles.

That could be unfair.

Some people might look for bad things.

Is this situation more serious?

I do not know.

I have Facebook. I worry about strangers knowing my information.

Once, I saw a TV show. A man quickly found a girl’s screen name and talked to her.

I would not meet someone from the internet.

Some people in my class know my screen name.

They know my interests and schedule.

I try to put only safe things on Facebook.

I do not want to limit it too much.

It is hard to know who can see my information.

My roommate said her high school banned Myspace.

I do not know if this is a privacy problem.

I do not understand why high school officials can tell students not to use Myspace.

I think about the Iraq War. I was against it from the start. I feel silly talking about it now. Most people think it was a mistake. Only a few people, like the administration, say it was a good idea.

Polls show many people think it was wrong. About seventy-five to eighty percent of people worldwide think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis and seventy percent of U.S. troops agree with this.

It has been a disaster since we started. It will be a disaster if we leave. The Middle East is very different from the U.S. We cannot bring democracy there. We should have considered the pros and cons before invading.

I do not see a reason to stay. The administration might have good reasons, but I do not agree. I do not know why we should stay longer.

Most Iraqis think we should leave now. We can ask them if we should stay. If they say yes and later there are problems, it is not our fault. We can help after.

We will never be good guys in the Middle East, but we will be better if we leave now.

Yes, I feel that gender discrimination is still happening in the United States.
It is not only with women. It happens in many fields of work.
I think women have more problems because of the glass ceiling. Even if they are qualified, many people prefer to hire men.
Society has been like this for a long time. Some women have good jobs, but they do not get promoted because traditionally, men are in charge.
The same thing happens to men. In fields like fashion or being a stay-at-home dad, it is not common.
People often think that men should work and be the breadwinners. They do not understand why a man stays at home.
In the fashion industry, people often do not take men seriously. They think men do not understand fashion because they are not women.
Depending on the job field, there is gender discrimination in the U.S.
It is hard to change because society has old ways of thinking. But women are getting more jobs and being accepted more.
Men who stay at home are also becoming more accepted.
People are starting to understand that women can have better jobs.
Also, there is discrimination based on where you come from. For example, if a person grew up on a farm and has bad grammar, other people might not trust them.
Sometimes, people discriminate based on gender too.
I do not know what else we can do. We are already working on it. Change takes time.

Marijuana was not legalized.
It was decriminalized.
This means it is now like a traffic ticket.
People are cited, not arrested.
Job interviews and other things can be affected.
Decriminalization does not change future problems.
Arresting people costs money.
It costs to bring them to court and appoint a lawyer.
Communities can save money by not arresting.
Denver saved money for schools and social programs.
Marijuana should not be everywhere.
It is bad for driving.
Society does not like it.
It is still a problem.
Alcohol also affects motor skills.
It depends on the person.
Some people use substances carefully.
Other people do not.
Each person reacts differently to substances.
They can both have problems.

I say yes.
Many things in the Catholic Church are old.
It is good to follow old traditions.
But, it is also important to change.
I think many Catholics go to church every week.
They say how things must be done.
Sometimes, I feel like the Church looks down on people who do not follow the rules.
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics.
They also do not accept people of other religions.
My dad was Episcopalian, my mom was Catholic.
They did not marry in the Catholic Church.
The Church said no because of my dad's religion.
This is not being kind to other religions.
They teach to love others, but they do not accept them.
Some Catholic rules tell people to do things, but the Church does not do it.
It is old-fashioned.
They still do it.
I think if priests could marry, it would be good.
I do not think it would stop them from doing bad things.
Bad things happen with or without a husband.
It is not about being married.
People who hurt children do it with or without a husband.
I do not think allowing priests to marry would stop this.
It would happen anyway.

I don’t have a clear opinion on this issue yet.
It’s very hard to decide if one side is right or wrong.
This topic is complex.
It’s close to issues of church and state.
It’s also hard to define marriage without causing offense.
I believe the government should treat all unions the same.
A civil union is just two people together.
No need to ask what kind of marriage it is.
If all states agree, they should make it a federal law.
But, a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is wrong.
The constitution should not be changed for this.
It’s not a big enough issue.
So, no.

I grew up in a Christian home. For me, homosexuality is a gray area.
I have many gay friends. I do not agree with that life, but I think it should be legal.
I do not think it should be a national issue.
I think each state should decide. It is not the president's decision.
Many states are democratic. Some are republican. Democratic states will push for gay marriage.
If you live in a democratic state, you know how that state feels about it.
I think you should not disagree with a state's decision if they decide to legalize gay marriage.
You chose to live there, after all.
I think homosexuals should have the same chances as heterosexuals. So, it should be legalized based on each state's choice.
I already answered this. But...
I do not think the president can decide for the whole country.
I do not agree with the ban on gay marriage. The president is not in every state.
He should not decide how each state runs.
It should be up to each state. It will go back and forth if it is up to the president.
He will be out of office in two years. It is better for each state to decide. They will live with the decision, not the president.

No, I don’t think so.
Let’s see, I think this:
Myspace is public.
Anyone can see what is posted.
If school officials see, it’s OK because:
They can access Myspace from home.
Preventing school shooting is good.
It’s the school’s job to keep students safe.
If officials check Myspace to catch students doing bad things, it’s OK.
But, it’s not OK if they just check for no reason.
They can’t just check to get students in trouble.
If they find something bad and make school safer, it’s OK.
Like, if they see students drinking or smoking, that’s bad.
They can check to make school safer.
Teachers told me we do safety drills.
Like, if there’s a terrorist attack, we practice.
School officials were just doing this to make school safe.
They were preventing bad things like school shootings.
It’s OK for police to check too.
Parents want school to be safe.
If they find something bad, they can report it.
Once something is on the internet, it’s always there.
You can’t take it back.
So, it’s not invasion of privacy if it’s for safety.

I was very angry after 9/11. I wanted to go to war in Afghanistan and Iraq. I thought we should cause as much trouble as they did to us. But now, I don't think it was a good idea. We didn't plan well and it didn't achieve much. The people in Afghanistan and Iraq are fighting each other. They can't fight us and each other at the same time. I don't think we should stay there. We can't change them. We should leave and let them sort out their own problems. I don't think the U.S. knew what to do in Afghanistan and Iraq. We were angry and not thinking clearly. We should have had a better plan. I think it's been a waste of time and resources. We can't stay there forever. We should leave.
