transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Many people are leaving the church. This is because the church is not accepting of many things, like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. The church's views on these topics are old-fashioned. If the church adapts to new ways of thinking, it will keep more people. People are turning away from the church because they do not agree with them on these subjects. The church is against abortion, so people who believe in it may not feel comfortable. The same with gay marriage. People who want to get married should not have to leave the church if they believe strongly about it. I do not see why the church should not allow female priests or married priests. The church says priests are married to God, but other people have both jobs and families. The church should change these rules.

I am not against gay marriage.
I think it is not a choice.
People should not be blamed for being gay.
It is not fair to say a man and a woman can marry but two people of the same sex cannot.
The federal government should not be involved.
Gay people should not be punished.

I think that gay marriage should be legal because there is no good reason not to.
Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to heterosexual families, but this is not true. Gay couples are different, but they are also the same in many ways.
They want the same civil rights as heterosexual couples. For example, if someone is sick, their partner should be able to visit and be there for them. This is not possible now because gay couples are not considered family.
Scientific studies show that gay couples have the same rates of success in relationships as heterosexual couples. They have the same factors that lead to satisfaction.
I think people are confused. Gay couples are not asking to get married in a church. They just want a legal marriage certificate from the government.
If there is no church involvement, then this should not be a problem.
The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. It is wrong to separate but equal. It is like segregation.
People worry about adoption and community issues. But gay couples and heterosexual couples are the same in many ways.
Children of gay couples can be treated the same as children of heterosexual couples.
The federal government should be involved in this issue.
I am not sure about the reasons President Bush has for not supporting gay marriage. I think he has strong views based on his religion.
Most people’s reasons for being against gay marriage are based on morality. Morality differs from person to person, so it should not be the basis for a law.
It is hypocritical for the government to create a law based on the beliefs of a certain religious group without considering other beliefs.
Many people think that gay people are psychologically damaged. This is not true. The American Psychological Association says that this is not true.
People should listen to institutions that do research on these subjects, not just their friends or neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. Some drugs are illegal but can help people. I think having illegal drugs available to the public is bad. But for medical use, it's good. I see many illegal drugs used in hospitals. Like oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet. These drugs are controlled but good for patients. Marijuana is also good for health. It should be legal for medicine. But, it should not be legal for everyone at once. It should be gradual. People think marijuana is bad because it's illegal. But it's not as dangerous as other drugs. If we change this image, people can use it responsibly for health. Not for everyone, just for medicine.

I think church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not so strict now. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday in a cute dress, matching shoes, and purse. I went to a private school and saw friends there. But now, they have a shorter service for teenagers. People wear casual clothes, even beach clothes. Families come late. Even morning masses are more casual. Church is like it is. I don’t know church politics. That’s my thought.

I thought the idea was okay at first. But after September 11, 2001, people were upset. The U.S. went to war in Iraq. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. This made me very angry.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who spoke at the UN, said he was not sure about the evidence. This is wrong. It is like not following the rules. It is like breaking the law.

I think the Bush administration wanted to go to war. They said they wanted to protect America. But I think they also wanted to get more oil. This is not good.

The war has gone on for a long time. It is hard to know what to do now. If we leave, Iraq might have a civil war. More people will die.

The UN and the U.S. want other countries to help. But this might cause more problems. Iraq’s government is weak. It is also not strong enough to lead the country. Radical groups want to take control. This is causing many problems.

I speak about the War in Iraq.
Mm-hmm.
I talk into it? Ok.
Yes, that is fine.
So, how I feel about it.
I see.
I think it is not very good. It is not a declared war.
I think it is just to get back at Iraq.
I believe they bombed the U.S.
I don't think it is fair to keep going.
I don't know all the details.
I think we are there to build democracy and get oil.
But it is not a good reason to stay.
If we stay, we must make democracy.
It will take a long time.
If we leave, they will be upset.
I don't know if it is the best.
War is hard.
I don't know how to say more.
Can you help me?
Yes, thank you.
I think the war should continue.
I don't think we should call it a war.
We use guns to show power.
We should not call it a war.
Congress must declare a war.
I don't think it is a big point to stay.
I think we should help them, but it wastes resources.
It makes Bush look bad.
I feel bad for him.
The Vietnam War was also not declared.
I think the war should end.
I don't want to say it should end.
Many families have sons and daughters in Iraq.
I want them to be safe.
I don't want them to be in danger.
But it is hard to say if we should stay.
They have a different culture.
We want to mold them like America.
It will make them hate us more.
It will make Al-Qaeda grow.
It will hurt us in the end.
I think the war will go on for years.
That is all.
Ok.

I don’t want it to be legal. It’s not right. It should be up to the churches. The constitution says separation of church and state.

It’s clear. It’s clear. It’s a law in the constitution. We shouldn’t change it.

Some people want it to be illegal. That’s like choosing one religion over another. Most Catholics and Christians don’t support it.

Separation of church and state is important. It’s a key part of the constitution. It’s for religious tolerance.

Making an amendment about this would be wrong. It goes against what is already said in the constitution.

Making this amendment would be the only one that restricts people. Not the government.

I don’t think the government should be involved. It’s not right for the president or anyone in government to decide this.

The president wants this amendment because he’s a Catholic. It’s his personal belief.

I think it’s up to the churches to decide. Not the president or anyone in government.

There’s no good reason for this amendment. It won’t help the economy. Maybe it will help society.

I think I said everything.

The Iraq War
I was not sure the government was honest about the reasons for war.
They tried to connect the war to the 9/11 attacks, but they were not the reason.
The government used the people's anger after 9/11 to start the war in 2003.
I did not want a preemptive strike war.
The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. Many soldiers died.
The government did not plan well for what would happen after removing Iraq's government.
They tried to make democracy in Iraq like they did in Vietnam.
It was a long, hard process. The US government should have been better prepared.
If you go to war, you must plan for all possible outcomes.
The American government was not prepared for what happened after the invasion.
Many troops are still dying and training Iraqis.
The government made people think the war would be easy and short.
Democracy takes a long time to succeed.
The Iraq War is a hard decision.
I wanted to vote for Bush to finish what he started in the 2004 election.
But the war is long and many Americans have died.
We must consider if it is worth risking more lives for Iraq's democracy.
The reason for the war was to make Iraq democratic, but not all countries with weapons are attacked.
The US government is not being thorough or honest about their decisions.
I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq soon, but likely not.

I like same-sex marriage.
I always have.
I think it is a personal choice.
It is okay if people feel this way.
It is not something that people can control.
It is not fair to take away rights because of this.
I think it is cruel.
I always support gay marriage.
I do not think government should be involved. This is personal, not political.
In my neighborhood, two gay couples live.
They act like any other family.
President Bush tries to change marriage's meaning.
It is not his job.
It is silly.
I read many stories about this.
Some think this is based on biology, not upbringing.
It is like if a person is predisposed to be gay.
It is not about growing up with sisters or no father.
If a man and woman want to marry, they can do it quietly.
If two people of the same sex want to marry, it becomes a big news story.
I think marriage should be private, not public.

When something goes on the internet, many people see it.
The internet is public.
This means, teachers and schools can also see it.
For example, if a student talks about bad things on the internet, the school might worry.
If the student talks about bad things like shootings or explosions,
people will take it seriously.
Schools have to check if these things are real.
They cannot ignore them.
The internet is a place where people share information.
People can see what others post.
If a teacher or school official sees bad things, they must act.
They cannot let bad things happen.
If a student talks about bad things, it is important.
It can be a real problem or a joke.
Some jokes seem like bad things.
This is why schools must check.
They cannot ignore something bad.
Teachers should not see students' private things.
They should not be friends with students on social media sites.
They should not look for bad things.
If a student talks about bad things, it is their own fault.
They should not do it.
If a teacher finds bad things, they must act.
They cannot ignore it.
They must protect students.
It is not their job to look for bad things.
They should only check if something bad is real.

The war has lasted too long.
We started for good reasons - to give democracy to Iraq.
But now, we don't know why we are fighting.
Maybe we just want to show we are strong.
George Bush's dad had problems with Saddam Hussein before.
So, it's not fair to say our purpose was just about helping Iraq.
We should have stopped when our message was clear.
We started the war, and that was enough.
The war has dragged on for years.
We should stop now.
Iraq should solve its own problems.
We are wasting money on this war.
We should use it to help our own country.
We have many problems here, like poverty and schools.
We should spend money on these problems, not war.
We are killing our own people in this war.
We have lost the cause for it.
We should stop now.

Can I ask a question? I want to understand what happened. Someone saw something online and prevented something bad. Was that okay? I think so. On Myspace, you usually can only see someone’s profile if you are their friend. But you must let them see it. So you understand that many people can see it. So if someone sees something bad, it can help. But it is not easy. One person cannot look at all profiles. That is not fair. It can be discrimination. But it is different if they are looking for something bad. It depends on why they looked. I have a Facebook. I worry about strange people seeing my information. I saw a TV show about a man who got information from a girl’s profile very quickly. I do not talk to people I do not know. But I worry about what people know about me. I try to limit what I put on Facebook. But I use it to talk to friends. It is a problem. I only accept people I know. But I do not know who can see what. My roommate said her school banned Myspace. I think that is not right. The school should not tell students they cannot have Myspace. I do not know what to think about privacy on the internet.

I must talk about the Iraq War.
I feel like I should not talk about this.
Many people say they were against it from the start.
But it is not important anymore.
Everyone agrees it was a bad idea.
Only the administration said it was okay.
I am sure many people will think it was a mistake.
Polls say that 75 to 80 percent of people think it was bad.
80 percent of Iraqis think it was bad.
70 percent of American troops think it was bad.
The war is a disaster.
It was bad before we went in.
Pulling out will be bad too.
It is hard to do anything in the Middle East.
Cultural differences are big.
The United States thinks it can bring democracy.
But people in the Middle East do not want this.
We should think about the good and bad before invading.
Saddam was bad, but it was not good to invade.
I do not know what to say.
I do not see a reason to stay.
The administration has ideas about why we should stay.
I do not agree.
I have not heard a good reason.
Maybe we can leave gradually.
But I do not see why we should not leave now.
80 percent of Iraqis want us to leave.
We should ask them.
If they say yes, we can leave.
Then we will not be responsible if things go bad.
At least we will not be the bad guys.
But we will not be good guys in the Middle East.
It will be better than now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
I feel this is true not only for women, but also for men.
Some jobs make it harder for women because people think women should not be in high positions.
For example, a woman might have all the skills for a job, but the boss might not give her the job because she is a woman.
The same can happen to men. For example, men who stay at home to take care of children are not accepted by society.
In the fashion industry, people do not take male designers seriously. This is because men are not usually seen as being knowledgeable about fashion.
I think there is gender discrimination in every job and every area of society.
It is hard to change this because society has been this way for a long time. But things are slowly changing, and it is getting better.
People are starting to accept women in higher positions and stay at home dads. They are realizing that women can have good jobs and men can work from home.
I don’t know what to do now because it is already being done. If we push too fast, people will resist. We have come far, but change takes time.
Sometimes, people discriminate against each other based on their job or where they grew up.
For example, a man might not be taken seriously if he has bad grammar.
I guess that would be another example of discrimination.

They did not make it legal. They made it a lesser crime. It is like a traffic ticket, not a serious crime. If people get caught, they do not face the worst consequences as with a drug charge. Decriminalization does not make the future problems go away. Arresting people costs a lot of money. Many places do not want to change the law even if it saves money. Denver did change the law. They have more money to spend on education and social programs. Marijuana should not be everywhere. It is taboo in many places. It is not like alcohol. It affects people's lives more. People react differently to substances. It is hard to make general rules about them.

Yes,
Many things in Church are old.
They do things the same way for long time.
Good to keep traditions.
But important to change too.
Many Catholics go to Church every week.
They follow rules strictly.
Sometimes, they do not accept others.
For example, my parents could not marry in Church.
My mom was Catholic, dad was Episcopalian.
They say love others.
But they do not accept others.
This is hypocritical.
Many rules say one thing, but Church does another.
It is old and outdated.
I think priests should marry. But, it will not stop bad things.
Because bad things happen, no matter if they marry or not.

I don't know about this.
I haven't decided yet.
It's hard to say who is right or wrong.
This topic is tricky. It's about church and state.
It's also about what marriage is.
It's hard to talk about without hurting someone's feelings.
I think marriage should be like a civil union.
The government should not ask about religion.
It's about two people, not their religion.
If all states agree, make it a federal law.
But don't make it a constitution amendment.
It's not big enough to change the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian home. This makes me unsure about homosexuality.
I have many gay friends. I do not agree with their lifestyle.
But I think it should be legalized.
I do not think it should be a national issue.
Each state should decide.
States are democratic or republican.
Democratic states will push for gay marriage.
If you live in a democratic state, you know their feelings.
You chose to live there, so you should accept their decision.
I think homosexuals should have equal opportunities.
I feel states should legalize it.
The president should not decide for the whole country.
Bush should not decide for all states.
The president will leave office soon.
A new president can change the law.
States should decide if they want to legalize it.
It should not be a national issue.

First, I supported the war. I felt angry about 9/11. I wanted to fight back. But now, I think we made a mistake. We did not plan well. We were not ready for what we faced. I think we should leave. The people there do not care about us. They are too busy fighting each other. War there is different from war here. They are not trying to improve. They just want us to leave. We should go. We were too angry to think clearly. We wanted revenge. We should have had a better plan. We did not know what to do. We were not united. We should have been clearer about our goals. We should not try to change them. They will always be like that. We are not helping them. We cannot stay forever. We are just hurting ourselves. We should leave.
